parameters.content:
=======================================
            WORKFLOW ASSISTANCE
=======================================
Scrape Indeed Job Listings for Hiring Signals Using Bright Data and LLMs

For any questions or support, please contact:
    Yaron@nofluff.online

Explore more tips and tutorials here:
   - YouTube: {{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}
   - LinkedIn: {{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}
=======================================
Bright Data Docs: {{ $env.WEBHOOK_URL }}

*Important*
Make Sure To Add Your API Keys to the HTTTP REQUESTS NODES (BRIGHT DATA API), GOOGLE RELATED NODES AND LLM NODE

nodes.name: Sticky Note1

parameters.content:
# üîç Indeed Jobs API ‚Äì Parameter Guide
Use this object to query Indeed job listings In Bright Data Web Scraper API.  
Each field lets you filter results based on different criteria.
```json
{
  "country": "US",
  "domain": "indeed.com",
  "keyword_search": "Software Engineer",
  "location": "Austin, TX",
  "date_posted": "Last 7 days",
  "posted_by": "Microsoft",
  "pay": 85000
}
```

## üßæ Field Explanations & Valid Options

### üåç country
**Required**
Country of the job, use 2-letter ISO code.
‚úÖ Example: "US", "FR", "DE"

### üåê domain
**Required**
The Indeed domain you want to collect from.
‚úÖ Example: "indeed.com", "fr.indeed.com"

### üß† keyword_search
**Required**
Search jobs by job title or company.
‚úÖ Example: "Data Scientist", "Marketing Manager"

### üó∫Ô∏è location
**Required**
Enter specific job location you want to discover.
‚úÖ Example: "New York", "London"

### ‚è±Ô∏è date_posted
Filter jobs by posting date.
Accepted values:
- Last 24 hours
- Last 3 days
- Last 7 days
- Last 14 days

‚úÖ Example: "Last 7 days"

### üëî posted_by
Filter jobs by posting entity or recruiter.
‚úÖ Example: "Company name", "Recruiter name"

### üí∞ pay
Filter jobs by salary or pay rate.
Use numerical values only.
‚úÖ Example: 50000, 75000

## ‚úÖ Full Example
```json
{
  "country": "US",
  "domain": "indeed.com",
  "keyword_search": "Software Developer",
  "location": "San Francisco",
  "date_posted": "Last 3 days",
  "posted_by": "Microsoft",
  "pay": 85000
}
```

nodes.name: Sticky Note2

parameters.content:
üß† Bright Data Trigger ‚Äì Customize Your Job Query

This HTTP Request sends a POST call to Bright Data to start a new dataset snapshot based on your filters.

üëã If you don‚Äôt want to use the Form Trigger,
you can directly adjust the filters here in this node.

You can customize:

"location" ‚Üí city, region, or keyword (e.g. "New York", "Remote")

"keyword" ‚Üí job title or role (e.g. "CMO", "AI Engineer")

"country" ‚Üí 2-letter country code (e.g. "US", "UK")

"time_range" ‚Üí "Past 24 hours", "Last 7 days", etc.



üìå Tip:
Use "Past 24 hours" or "Last 7 days" for the freshest results.

nodes.name: Workflow Documentation

parameters.content:
# Stickynote Workflow

## Overview
Automated workflow: Stickynote Workflow. This workflow integrates 10 different services: stickyNote, httpRequest, formTrigger, wait, splitOut. It contains 26 nodes and follows best practices for error handling and security.

## Workflow Details
- **Total Nodes**: 26
- **Node Types**: 10
- **Error Handling**: ‚úÖ Implemented
- **Security**: ‚úÖ Hardened (no sensitive data)
- **Documentation**: ‚úÖ Complete

## Node Breakdown
- **Sticky Note9**: stickyNote
- **Snapshot Progress**: httpRequest
- **Sticky Note10**: stickyNote
- **Sticky Note1**: stickyNote
- **On form submission - Discover Jobs**: formTrigger
- **HTTP Request- Post API call to Bright Data**: httpRequest
- **Wait - Polling Bright Data**: wait
- **If - Checking status of Snapshot - if data is ready or not**: if
- **HTTP Request - Getting data from Bright Data**: httpRequest
- **Google Sheets - Adding All Job Posts**: googleSheets
- ... and 16 more nodes

## Usage Instructions
1. **Configure Credentials**: Set up all required API keys and credentials
2. **Update Variables**: Replace any placeholder values with actual data
3. **Test Workflow**: Run in test mode to verify functionality
4. **Deploy**: Activate the workflow for production use

## Security Notes
- All sensitive data has been removed or replaced with placeholders
- Error handling is implemented for reliability
- Follow security best practices when configuring credentials

## Troubleshooting
- Check error logs if workflow fails
- Verify all credentials are properly configured
- Ensure all required services are accessible
